meanings.definition: Having no further possibility of action or progress; finished.
meanings.sent1: The puzzle was finito, with all pieces in place.
meanings.sent2: After the race, the marathon runner felt finito.
meanings.sent3: The cookie jar was finito after the kids found it.
meanings.sent4: The book was finito, closing the chapter on their adventure.
meanings.sent5: The battery was finito, unable to power the toy anymore.

meanings.sent1: As the movie credits rolled, it was clear the film had reached its finito.
meanings.sent2: The finito of the play left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent3: The finito of the party came too soon for the guests.
meanings.sent4: The finito of the song echoed in the empty hall.
meanings.sent5: The finito of the journey marked a new beginning for the travelers.
